application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.p: • E791 and FOCUS used EM and hadronic calorimeters to loosely trigger on hadronic events slightly enriched with charm. Goal is charm production and decays.
• SELEX used online vertex trigger based on miss distance. Goal is high-x F baryons, especially charm-strange baryons.
Branching Ratios (D 0 )
• Deviations from naïve weak prediction give information about QCD
div.formula: • Use the decay BR D 0 →K − K + K − π + D 0 →K − π + π − π +
div.p: to measure ss popping penalty

div.head: E791
div.p: Kπππ Yield = 14472±134

div.p: Direct CP Violation search:
div.formula: • Measure A CP = η(D + →K s h + ) − η(D − →K s h − ) η(D + →K s h + ) + η(D − →K s h − )
div.p: • Normalize to another mode to account for production asymmetries
div.formula: CP Asymmetry FOCUS A CP (K s π + ) w.r.t. K − π + π + (−1.6±1.5±0.9)% A CP (K s K + ) w.r.t. K − π + π + (6.9±6.0±1.8)% A CP (K s K + ) w.r.t. K s π + (7.1±6.1±1.4)% Branching Ratio (Ξ + c → pK − π + )
div.p: • Only Cabibbo-suppressed decay of a charm-strange baryon ever seen • First observed by SELEX; also seen by FOCUS SELEX: Dalitz plot analyses shown:
div.formula: • D + → K + K − π + (FOCUS) • D + s → π + π − π + (E791 & FOCUS) • D + → π + π − π + (E791) • D + → K − π + π + (E791) • D + → K + π − π + (FOCUS) • D + s → K + π − π + (FOCUS)

div.p: Interaction can proceed in two ways:
div.formula: Annihilation diagram Via resonance which couples to KK & ππ c s _ W + π + π − π + c W + d _ u s _ π + π − s • f 0 (980)

div.p: E791 D + s → π − π + π + resonant analysis • Fit for resonant amplitudes and phases

• Large errors on f 0 (980) and f 0 (1370) parameters ⇒ fit for these parameters f 0 (1370) parameters M f 0 (1370) = 1434 ± 18 ± 9 MeV/c 2 Γ f 0 (1370) = 172 ± 32 ± 6 MeV/c 2 f 0 (980) parameters (coupled channel Breit Wigner) M f 0 (980) = 977±3±2 MeV/c 2 g π = 0.09 ± 0.01 ± 0.01 g K = 0.02 ± 0.04 ± 0.03

div.head: E791 FOCUS
div.p: Resonance

• Exploring the nature of final-state interactions is ongoing • Evidence for W-annihilation contributions seems to be lacking so far • Resonant analysis will allow direct CP violation searches of multi-body decay modes • FOCUS will have its hands full analyzing many decay modes
• Hopefully the e + e − experiments will also contribute
